review_title: Great company to work for and always busy!!

job_title: ER Tech in Burleson, TX

job_title: ED RN in San Antonio, TX
pros: Id give 5 stars but nowhere is perfect, especially for nurses. However, when I weighed staying at home and finding a local job versus traveling, this place won me over. They are currently, as of 11/2022, offering a 20k bonus for 2 years. They won’t pay it up front (smart) but will pay $2500 every 90 days for up to 2 years on top of base pay which varies from location to location. I get an additional 3 dollars an hour for working at the Baptist Neighborhood Hospital located on Cupples or Zarzamora. Emerus has a relationship to staff the 8 Baptist Neighborhood Hospitals located throughout San Antonio. The above listed locations are in the less affluent parts of San Antonio, hence the 3 dollar differential. Another 3 dollars is added to my base pay for hours AFTER 7 pm. Emerus or Baptist Neighborhood Hospital also offers bonuses ranging from $100-$1000 for any staff picking up shifts in desperate need of filling. Example: If I chooses to work a shift such as being a sitter for a 1:1, my pay doesn’t change. I get paid my RN hourly pay + bonus. Great benefits at a range of costs. I cover my entire family with PPO for $290/pay period.
cons: People who have been at Zarzamora since it opened, especially 2 particular women, are click-y, rude, and take it upon themselves to boss all the new people around. They love pointing out the bad things about what one is doing and then expect help without ever saying thanks or acknowledging. I believe it is why Emerus has problems staffing the Zarzamora location. No one reports them for fear of internal retaliation but they make the culture kinda suck. The manager is sweet. All other locations are great. They need staff so go apply!!!

job_title: Patient Access Specialist in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Pros have been long gone.
cons: Management, company focus is all about the money hidden by patient satisfaction training.

job_title: Patient Access Specialist in The Woodlands, TX

job_title: Imaging Services Program Director in San Antonio, TX
pros: Team approach patient care. As a radiology technologist you will have the opportunity to learn new skills to create the team approach. It's the TEAM approach that I love so much.
cons: I think because the environment is so different from a big box hospital or out patient facility radiology techs are unsure on what to expect and tend to shy away from applying. Don't be shy! This is a great company!

job_title: Pharmacist in Pittsburgh, PA
pros: Work like balance. However you will be exhausted from loss of sleep.
cons: Pharmacists are used as pawns to get a license needed with the state board of pharmacy and thus a department of health license for the hospital.  The whole process is disorganized, chaotic, unprofessional, and unethical.  Be prepared for absolute lack of leadership and a complete lack of understanding of your state's requirements regarding pharmacy law. Be advised-there are serious risks to your license.  So disappointing.

review_title: Great company going through growing pains
job_title: in The Woodlands, TX
pros: My co-workers were a lot of fun and kind.  There is lots of opportunity to learn new things.  There is never a dull moment.  This company has great potential to become a revolutionary company that can greatly impact the healthcare world.  Upper management are awesome individuals.  They are very kind and generous.  They do care about their employees.
cons:
While the company is a corporation with over a 1000 employees it is run very much like a small business.  Everyone juggles a lot.  You could say it's like a skeleton crew.  Be prepared to work more than 40 hours.  The work load is very high.  

For a family that has lot of medical needs the insurance was very expensive, but maybe that's just how the economy is these days.

review_title: Beware of getting baited with false promises
job_title: Anonymous Employee in The Woodlands, TX
pros: the location itself and the scenery is beautiful. I enjoy my drive there and my drive home. nice amenities.
cons: You get hired on and everything goes well the first two weeks. after that the communication slowly begins to stop. you have no clear understanding to what your actual duties are as management constantly changes their expectations and assignments. company spends more time criticising what you're not doing correctly which will wear you down. used to enjoy coming in. now it seems like the entire CBO is miserable. don't dare make a suggestion that would increase productivity. they're scared of change. very high turnover. they should go back to being more family oriented. when people feel appreciated you'd be amazed how it could change the entire atmosphere

job_title: Registered Nurse in Las Vegas, NV
pros: Small network of co-workers - extreme autonomy
cons:
One sick patient and you are all alone.  Although you have numerous unqualified staff to "help" you - your license will be on the line.  Very dangerous.  No 24 hour pharmacist so you mix your own medications like amio - heparin - keppra - dilt drips from pre-made recipe cards.  You second RN is a Med/Surg nurse who has to taken a critical care class, so as the ER nurse, you are literally all alone.  Leadership will say to call them if you need help, however they are very slow to call you back and often of weekends will not call back at all or show up.  
 Benefits are outrageously expensive - and the pay is very low for this market.

review_title: Good team members, terrible I.T. upper management.
job_title: I T in The Woodlands, TX
pros: Team members work hard and are easy to get along with. Expectations are reasonable.  The atmosphere is very family like and most people are welcoming.  The company is growing rapidly, which means long hours, below average wages, but good possibility for growth in the long run.
cons: I.T. Upper management is very bad.  When things go wrong they are primarily concerned with making themselves look good and cast the blame on their team. They do not take suggestions and are quick to overpower you when suggestions are brought up. It seems that when talking to them what you are saying doesn't register because they are thinking about their rebuttals. Team members are great, many of us had the same thoughts about upper management.

review_title: Great opportunities with great teamwork structure in place!
job_title: Anonymous Employee in The Woodlands, TX
pros: Emerus has an environment of learning, teamwork and appreciation for its employees. This is definitely an environment for learning, growth and development. No workplace is perfect, but it did not take me long to observe how Emerus strives to maintain its culture for employees.
cons: I honestly have not encountered any cons; I've only been onboard for a couple months. If I had to state something here it would to have better medical benefits. I would hope for better options for medical insurance in the future. Slightly costly.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in The Woodlands, TX
pros:
Excellent culture to which everyone knows the value they bring to the overall patient experience, even here from the corporate office. The feel is like a tech start-up in healthcare and that's a positive for me. 
Leadership at all levels are approachable and show genuine concern.
cons: It is a time of transition from a medium-sized company to a larger one. Growth pains around communication and change are to be expected but the light at the end of the tunnel will make it all worth it.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Antonio, TX
pros: Love working for this company! The culture is different from any other hospital based company I've worked for. Emerus really takes good care of their patients AND their employees. The company is experiencing a lot of growth which creates many different career and promotional opportunities for the staff.
cons: Very few cons come with this company - the only thing that comes to mind would be compensation. There are a few positions within the company - both clinical and managerial - that are not being paid the competitive wage/salary that is deserved.

job_title: Employee in Dallas, TX
pros: Used to be a good company.
cons: Used to be a good company. CEO left, new management. Pay was above industry standards but is now being heavily cut to prop up poorly performing facilities in other states. There used to be profit sharing and bonuses. All are gone and employee pay is being slashed to well below industry standards. New management no longer cares about the employees. Company has totally lost its focus of being different than your normal healthcare model. Whole departments are quitting. Upper management hides large company changes. Expanded too large too fast and they're now balancing the budget on the backs of employees.

job_title: Senior Recruiter in The Woodlands, TX
pros: Emerus has an excellent company culture!  It's a family type environment where everyone genuinely cares about each other.  I can't say enough great things about the leadership.  They are open, honest and approachable.  Quality of Work/Life balance.  This is by far the best company I've ever worked for!
cons: I can honestly say that the only negatives I experienced have worked their way out of the company.  There are still some growing pains, but it keeps it challenging and managmement is always there to help.

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: The parent company is patient centered and cares about each employee. They strive to make the company a fun filled place to work and are generous to their employees and beleive in strong team building at all levels. The pay is comparable to larger facilities with less stress and usually close to home for most of us. A great company to work for as a whole. They promote family time and not working your life away. They encourage you to balance work and home. They provide you the ability to spend with your patients that you would have in no other facility.
cons: The growth has been so fast, almost feels too pushed after completing one area and jumping to the next without spending the time to invest in and ensure the one just finished is solid. Their is a huge difference in the upper parent management and delivery of our purpose and changes that are necessary from our local management. Each facility is said to be created of the same blueprint for ease of employees to help in several and know where to get things and know our processes.The problem is that each facility has adapted their own beliefs and steps of those processes which creates issues and uncomfortableness for the employees trying to help a sister facility.

job_title: Functional Leader in The Woodlands, TX
pros: Company is very committed to prviding excellent service to patients and creating the best environment for employees. Company still offers company picnics and oher events targeted at the family not just "employee only." Leaders are accessible and passionate about our patients, the company and employees.
cons: Company is scaling quickly which places pressure on internal processes and systems. This pressure along with the speed of change that comes with growth can place high demands on employees.

job_title: CBO in The Woodlands, TX
pros: Cafe onsite is nice, you don’t have to leave work once you get there. Can pick your own shift.
cons: HR does nothing with employee complaints. Supervisors either talk to rudely or they don’t talk at all and let the team lead-who they act like they are scared of- run the department. Don’t tell your lead/supervisor anything personal the entire dept will know. Bonuses are always being threatened to be taken away. They will write you up for not being social but will let others who constantly mess up keep their jobs. Raises are less than 25 cents a year.

job_title: Tech in San Antonio, TX
pros: Beautiful facillity with top of the line equipment. Speedy treatment time and excellent patient care policies. Very qualified experienced staff. Opportunity for growth by learning new skills and most employees are very nice to each other.
cons: There are a couple employees whose work ethic does not match what the company claims to insist on.

review_title: Handsdown the absolute BEST place I have ever worked! Emerus is not the typical hospital.
job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX
pros: The absolute BEST place I have ever worked! I feel like much more than  'an employee' here. Energetic  positive atmosphere, Phenomenal team work, dependable,  knowlegable staff. Management team is incredible! There is an outstanding dedication to the employees and the community. This place is a once in a lifetime career opportunity.
cons: insurence package is less than desirable at this time but will be changing soon!

job_title: ER Technician in Burleson, TX
pros: Facility management is very friendly and cooperative. Facilities are adequately staffed for the average patient volume and they have no issue hiring more if needed. Individual needs are met within reason while maintaining the needs of the facility.
cons: Hourly pay is disappointing compared to other positions I have held at stand alone emergency rooms, some co-workers have no work ethic but that is at every job.

job_title: Front Office Coordinator in Mansfield, TX
pros: Emerus is a company that truly cares for its employees. I get excited about going to work each day. Your coworkers feel more like family than just coworkers. Upper management and leadership encourage support and listen.
cons: I have nothing negative to say about Emerus, they always exceed my expectations.

review_title: Worked as a Surgical Technologist but  processed and wrapped all my instruments for Main Autoclave in Sterile Processing

job_title: Registered Nurse in San Antonio, TX

job_title: Anonymous Employee in San Antonio, TX

job_title: Anonymous Employee in The Woodlands, TX

job_title: Anonymous Employee in The Woodlands, TX
pros: Excellent leadership and experience opportunity. Very relaxed work environment, you will not be micro-managed. Very fast-paced, but not in a negative way. Amazing and hard-working people, amazing company.
cons: Let's not be nit-picky.

job_title: in Dallas, TX
pros: At Emerus we work as a TEAM not as individuals.  At Emerus you will find Empathy, Integrity and Excellence in our staff.  Emerus cares about employees and patients.  Emerus is a great place to work and a great place to visit.
cons: At Emerus the environment is great at this point I have not seen any cons.

cons: I currently have no complaints. Everyone has been super nice. The corporate individuals are very nice, patient and helpful. Most ppl have been the company for many years

job_title: in The Woodlands, TX
